newsitem.title: INDIA: Delhi shares slip lower on settlement end.
newsitem.headline: Delhi shares slip lower on settlement end.

text.p: Delhi share prices drifted lower in early afternoon trade on Friday as foreign and domestic financial institutions squared positions on the last day of the current settlement period, brokers said.
The Delhi Stock Exchange's sensitive index was 6.77 points lower at 763.71 points at 12:45 p.m. (0715 GMT).
"Activity was mostly of the squaring-up nature with operators preferring to reduce their positions," said Bharat Bhushan Gupta of brokers Multiple Investments.
Reliance Industries fell 2.85 rupees to 287.75 on selective selling by speculators and institutional investors, brokers said.
TISCO dropped 5.75 rupees to 174.55 ahead of the announcement of results for 1996/97 (April-March), expected after 3:30 p.m. (1000 GMT).
State Bank of India drifted 3.00 rupees lower to 302.50.
